snippet: Scientists in England are trying to sequence a long-dead monarch’s genome, and European researchers find more evidence that marijuana increases the appetite.
abstract: The Week column; British scientists hope to discover color of King Richard III's eyes by using his bones, found under parking lot in Leicester, England, in 2012, to sequence his genome; also hope to discover what infectious bacteria he was hosting when he died at Battle of Bosworth in 1485; other significant news in science and medicine highlighted.
lead_paragraph: Scientists in England are trying to sequence a long-dead monarch’s genome, and European researchers find more evidence that marijuana increases the appetite.

headline.print_headline: King Richard III’s Eyes, and the Munchies
headline.main: King Richard III’s Eyes, and the Munchies
